availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Goble (Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and first lieutenant)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Son of Isaac Goble and Jane F. Goble. Married to Emmaline Hanna Goble. Father of Margaret Goble, Mary Goble, Francis Goble, and Sarah Goble. Farmer in Johnson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Commissioned to the 39th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant on September 6, 1862. Captured in Floyd County on December 4, 1862. Confined at Richmond, Virginia, from May 4, 1863, to May 5, 1863. Served in the 39th Kentucky Infantry as first lieutenant to September 15, 1865.
